contribution.name: 0 Model(秋田)
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: Built in 1993, This model was introduced to improve efficiency by replacing the one-man units in the North-East. Used on the Ouu line from Sakata to Aomori and the Tsugaru line.

contribution.name: 100 Model / 3Car formation(秋田)
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: Built in 1993, This 3-car model was introduced to improve efficiency by replacing the one-man units in the North-East. The auxiliary power supply appeared after 94, converted from the MG model and are modified in SIV. Once the Yamagata Shinkansen Shinjo extension was built, this model was transformed into the Sendai Train Ku.

contribution.name: 1000 Model (Sendai / 2Car formation)
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: In Sendai area, 701 Series Trains were used, though replaced later by the 715 Series and 455 Series. The formations (KUHA 700 + KUMOHA 701) and (KUHA 700 + モハ 701 + Saha 700 + KUMOHA 701) exist. The 2-Car formation is a one-man driving setup. The 4-Car has no door chime.

contribution.name: 1000 Model(Sendai / 4-Car formation)
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: Sendai 地区では、701 Series Trains were used, though replaced later by the 715 Series and 455 Series. The (KUHA700＋KMOHA701) and the 4-Car (KUHA700＋MOHA701＋SEHA700＋KUMOHA701) Formations exist. The 4-Car Formation does not have the One-Man Driver or Door Chime?. This model is used between Ichinoseki and Shiraishi.

contribution.name: 5000 Model(Tazawako Line)
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: This train is used on the Tazawako Line, since the opening of the Akita Shinkansen. It is only used when required for business or festivals between Omagari and Akita, like the Omagai Fireworks festival.

contribution.name: 5500 Model(Yamagata)
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: Built in 1993. Between the Ouu to Uetsu Mainline, this train was purposely selected for the passenger service. Later on, it was moved to the North East area. As for the 5500 Model, at the time of the Yamagata Shinkansen Extension, it became the standard service.

contribution.name: Third sector railroad
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: North East Shinkansen from Morioka to Hachinoe and between, within the third section of the JR old main lines. As for the basic structure of the vehicle, the JR701 Series is the same except for the semi-cross seating arrangement. Also used on the Milky Way Railway.

contribution.name: Third sector railroad
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: North East Shinkansen from Morioka to Hachinoe and between, within the third section of the JR old main lines. As for the basic structure of the vehicle, the JR701 Series is the same except for the semi-cross seating arrangement and toilet being installed. Also used on the Blue Forest Railway.

contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The 165 Series is used in the suburbs of Niigata but they are getting older. They have two doors for busy times and were produced to replace older models. The 701 Series has a direct current and is made of stainless steel, has long seats and VVVF Inverter in the driving trailer. This model is mainly used in the suburbs of Niigata and Matsumoto.

contribution.name: Daiito Line Color
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: Stainless steel is used inside the carriages, a VVVF Inverter is installed to allow enegry saving, reduced maintenance and better control. The body is a 3-Door type (Box shape). One side of the interior, it has long seats installed already. As for formations, the 2-Car formation was introduced in December, 1998.

contribution.name: Suburban
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: In March 2003, JR West 's Kohama Line (East Maizuru～Tsuruga) became electrified. There is only one type of KUMOHA125, but seperate and one-man driving is possible. It's top speed is 120km/h (Though on the Kohama Line, the top speed is 85km/h).

contribution.name: Moon Light Echigo (Niigata)
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The Kamimettari 165 Series Ｍ Formation travels from Shinjuku to Niigata. It is called the Murakami Sugaya "Moon Light Echigo (Niigata)". Also, When not running as the Moon Light, it runs as the "Fairway (Shinjuku～Kuroiso)".

contribution.name: High Speed Sendai City Rabbit
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The 455 Series used to be the express train known as "Matsushima" or "Zaou" but is now split and used in suburban 3-Car formations. From 1988 to 1991, A part of the new carriages was reconstruced. This train was used on the North East mainline from Kuroiso to Sendai to Rifu to Ichinoseki, the Tokiwa Line from Sendai to Mito and also on the West Line. On the Tokiwa Line, the 9-Car formations could be seen. The only high speed use for this train is the down-train (leaving Tokyo) high speed "Sendai City Rabbit" travels Fukushima to Sendai.

contribution.name: SENZAN LINE 455
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: This train stated driving on the Senzan Line from the 14th of October, 1997. The carriages were repainted in Blue and White to match the Zaou landscape.

contribution.name: BANETSU LINE 455
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: Frp, 1996, this color scheme was used on the new West Line. The 7-Car formation is used between Kooriyama and Kitakata. The new color scheme has been applied to all cars. In December, 1999, it was superceeded and is now used very irregularly around Sendai.

contribution.name: INTER CITY TRAIN 169
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The E127 Series from Nagano was used to replace the 169 Series of Mitakaku. As for the same car as for the form which with 9 (holiday high speed picnic) runs the central high speed line the Shinkansen relay number, holiday entering the use of high speed and Ogaki relief overlooking etc..., althought the paint is very different, it closely resembles 169 Series of the past years.

contribution.name: Nagano Color
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: This is the color schemed adopted in 1993 for the Nagano Winter Olympics (115, 165 and 169 Series.) Only the outside was painted.

contribution.name: Misuzu Color
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The 4 Car formation consisted of a Saha 165 Series in the center of 169 Series 3 Car Formation. It is used in Nagano on the Shinetsu main line. As for appearance, the design of the N has a green stripe on the ivory body (called the N stripe). It uses the reclining seats of the Shinkansen assuring an improvement in the interior design.

contribution.name: General Purpose Rail-Car
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: This model was produced to replace the KIHA58 Series, etc... It has an engine as powerful as the KIHA85 (350ps, 120km/h). Each car has 3 doors and cross-seats. They are used for high speed services on the Taketoyo line.

contribution.name: Suburban Rail-Car
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The design partly borrows from the Tokai Line model, this model is used as a short-range suburban service.

contribution.name: Super-Express Rail-Car
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: Although kiha181 series had been used on intercity services of the Sanin line, JR West developed kiha187 series in order to increase the competitive power against motorcars in 2000 and entered “Super Oki” services and “Super Kunibiki” services in 2001.

contribution.name: Suburban Rail-Car(YDC125)
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The KIHA125 was created to run on low-traffic lines where the KIHA200 was too big. As for the body, it's a rail bus built by the Niigata ironworker production (NDC) company. The interior and exterior paint is that of the "Down Design" from the Mitooka Research.

contribution.name: Suburban Rail-Car
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The final model of the Japanese National Railways, with stainless steel body conversion and cross seat equipment. It uses to the Yutaka to Hisashi to Ooturu to Hisatsu line.

contribution.name: Kansai Line Color
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The first light rail-car after the innauguration of JR West. This is the 0 Model where the engine is modified to 330 PS. It uses the "Long seat" formation.

contribution.name: New Super-Express
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: After the Shinkansen Ueno started operating, this model was considered for use on the local railroad super-express, 185 Series 200 was remodelled in 1982. 185 Series 0 required cold-proof resistance due to the cold weather. 200 Model are considered, the joining of 165 Series side lightly have become the measure car making provision for passing of the Usui pass. Renewal construction was done, reclining seat conversion of the standard-sized car completed.

contribution.name: Izu Super-Express "Dancer"
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: This train is the Tokyo and Izu Super-Express. Built in 1981, the 185 Series 0 had a new super-express shape. It runs the same routes as the 153 Series. The 185 Series replaced the 117 Series suburban which were used as the one for new high speed as the basis in Kansai area.

contribution.name: Izu Super-Express "Dancer"
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: This train is the Tokyo and Izu Super-Express. Built in 1981, the 185 Series 0 had a new super-express shape. It runs the same routes as the 153 Series. The 185 Series replaced the 117 Series suburban which were used as the one for new high speed as the basis in Kansai area. It has recently been remodelled with new colors and reclining seats.

contribution.name: Izu Mixed Express
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: This train consists of a 185 Series and 153 Series train. It usually has 10 185 Series cars, with an additional 5 153 Series joined. This was a super express before the Izu Super-Express 'Dancer' was introduced.

contribution.name: Super-Express "Amagi" "Shirone"
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The 157 Series is used as a Resort Express in the Central region. The DX model possesses equipment like the Super-Express. It was designed off the JNR model.

contribution.name: Hokuriku Express Train
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The 471 Series "Osamu" appeared on the Hokuriku main lane (60 Hz). As it participates in the numerous bullet trains, the super express is converted gradually, reaching the point where it is used even as local trains.

contribution.name: Blue Liner
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: When (1972) the Shinkansen was extended to Okayama, devices from the bullet train (153 Series) became possible. This included air-conditioning, speed up, air cushions, etc. From the area came competition with the private railway corporations, the 117 Series won.

contribution.name: City Liner
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: This train introduced the speed up and the reclining seat between capital Osaka and Kobe which competed with private railway corporations from 1980. The comfort, changing with unique style, to 153 Series blue liners which such as streamlined lead coach, bore the role of new high speed.

contribution.name: Tokai Liner
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: This train was introduced into the Kansai area and Nagoya area (Tokai liner) in 1982. It replaced the high speed 153 and 165 Series. From 1986, it was used on the central west line (6-Car and 4-Car). Later, the 211 Series and the like participated, but the new 311 Series started from 1989. From this time it was repainted in the corporate color of the company. The vehicle received a long seat conversion remodelling at 1992

contribution.name: 300 Model (Fukuchiyama Color)
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: This formation was remodelled for the Fukuchiyama line. It resembles the Tokai Coloring, but is not the same. In addition, the 300 Model has 2 seats more and this assures less congestion when getting on and off.

contribution.name: Sun Liner
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: The intermediate car of the 115 Series 3500 Model (the Okayama Express & Hiroshima) it was remodelled in March, 1992. It then serviced Okayama where it was then used as the high speed "Sun Liner" between Fukuyama. It saw normal operational in the Okayama area and as a temporary high speed "Sun Liner". It drove to Kyoto in 1994. After it was stopped as the "Sun Liner" to Fukuyama, Holidays between Hiroshima used the high speed "Super Rabbit". Currently, it has been remodelled to one-man driving.

contribution.name: Ocean Color
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: Used in the Wakayama area (Wakayama line), the 0-300 Model (one-man) had been remodelled but was then discontinued in 2001. The south Super-Express "Ocean Arrow" Train which uses the same area (285 Series) adopted the same paint the color.

contribution.name: High Speed Mixed Color
contribution.author: TAKUROU
contribution.description: New high speed 221 Series used to compliment high speed services.
